qas.question: In what century did the Nationalistic revolutions occur?
How many years after world war I did world war II start?
What withdrew the political boundaries of West Asia?
What did the partitioning of the Otto Empire bring about?

answers.text: the modern Arab world and the Republic of Turkey.

qas.question: Who did The League of Nations grant  France mandates over?

context: Ultimately, World War I created a decisive break with the old world order that had emerged after the Napoleonic Wars, which was modified by the <a0_0>mid-19th century's<a0_0/> nationalistic revolutions. The results of World War I would be important factors in the development of World War II approximately <a1_0>20 years later.<a1_0/> More immediate to the time, the <a2_0>partitioning of the Ottoman Empire<a2_0/> was a political event that redrew the political boundaries of West Asia. The huge conglomeration of territories and peoples formerly ruled by the Sultan of the Ottoman Empire was divided into several new nations. The partitioning brought the creation of <a3_0>the modern Arab world and the Republic of Turkey.<a3_0/> The League of Nations granted France mandates over <a4_0>Syria and Lebanon<a4_0/> and granted the United Kingdom mandates over Mesopotamia and Palestine (which was later divided into two regions: Palestine and Transjordan). Parts of the Ottoman Empire on the Arabian Peninsula became parts of what are today Saudi Arabia and Yemen.
